website_summaries.verdict: Enriched by its occasional launches throughout the years, the Puma Clyde Premium Core continued the legacy of basketball pro, Walter "Clyde" Frazier. It's vintage appeal catered to interests of customers who are inclined to classic shoes and are looking for a nostalgic experience. With an upgrade from the pioneer model, the shoe boasts supreme comfort and durability without disregarding a smooth, minimalist style.
pros: The Puma Clyde Premium Core's rich history, along with sterling features, entitled the shoe to be listed on the recommendation list
A few users praised the shoe's perfect fit and sizing
More than a couple of customers stated that they had bought another color of the pair and even one of them plans to buy all of the available colors
A tiny number of buyers commended the shoe's exceptional comfort
Retaining the silhouette of the original release, the Puma Clyde Premium Core's image is much appreciated by a very a small number of reviewers
Equipped with superior materials, a couple of users applauded the sneaker's high-quality build
A little number of purchasers expressed their adoration for the shoe's excellent value for money
cons: More than a handful of reviewers disliked the shoe's narrow width, and even a percentage of them were annoyed with the very tight fit and its small size

customer_reviews.title: I like both pairs I bought
customer_reviews.text: I've worn suede pumas on/off since I was 11 years old(33 years now ). But, I'd never seen or owned the Clyde Frazier model. I like both pairs I bought. They where a slight more narrow than the standard classic suede pumas at the onset but I don't notice it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Bump Lung

customer_reviews.title: just ok.
customer_reviews.text: The shoe itself is nice and seems well made. 2 things to be aware of: 1) the shoe color is not as it appears on the screen. It is much brighter with less of a light / medium blue undertone and more aquamarine. 2) The insert on these shoes is the worst I've ever seen. It's like someone decided to put the hardest possible material in the bottom of an otherwise comfortable shoe. Thankfully the insert does come out and can be replaced, but I've never had to do that with new shoes. Be aware of the added cost.
customer_reviews.author: T. Wolf

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE OF BLISTERS
customer_reviews.text: I've bought a bunch of pairs of similar Puma's over the years with no problem at all. For some reason these were so much stiffer. Order a half-sized up for sure, they were tight. Walked about .7 miles on my first morning in them and got to my destination with terrible painful blisters on the backs of my ankles. Hoping they improve once I break them in...
customer_reviews.author: Baker Family

customer_reviews.title: Order a half size larger than you normally do.
customer_reviews.text: Usually wear a men's size 10. Ordered a 10.5 due to the reviews I read. Glad I did. Fit great. Like the style and color. Just got them, so not sure how they will wear. My advice: Order a half size larger than you normally do.
